abstract: Syracuse, NY, officials are suing COR Development Company, which received millions of dollars from city and state to build hotels, upscale apartments and stores along city's Inner Harbor, claiming developer is avoiding local-hiring requirements that city would impose in exchange for tax breaks; case has triggered debate over whether developers who receive public money are obligated to provide residents of impoverished communities with assistance.
lead_paragraph: The Inner Harbor project, in which a developer has received millions in public money, has started a debate about the obligations of builders to give residents meaningful aid.

headline.main: Questions on Subsidies and Local Hiring Surround Syracuse Project
headline.print_headline: Questions on Subsidies and Local Hiring Surround Project

snippet: The Inner Harbor project, in which a developer has received millions in public money, has started a debate about the obligations of builders to give residents meaningful aid.
